instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1707: What is A1707? A1707 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928..
definitions.820-00281: What is 820-00281? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U5000: What is U5000? This is the System Management Controller(SMC) in macbooks from 2013-2015.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Battery use -> no backlight...
threads.message:
Hey guys. 
I have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 15'' which teases me a lot. First of all; The logic board is in excellent condition. Absolutely clean and looks new. 
The problem is that the machine works and runs perfectly normally when the battery is unplugged. When I have the original battery in it boots as it should, but quite quickly the backlight flashes and then goes out. It takes 20 v and charges the battery with 3.9-4.0 amp, but the backlight disappears. Without battery: normal power consumption
I have tried three different batteries and it does the same thing.
I think it might be <CHIP>U5000</CHIP> (SMC problem) and will look at <SIGNAL>TCON_BKLT_PWM</SIGNAL> line tomorrow at the office. If anyone has an obvious solution, I'd like to hear it :-)

Thank you all and especially 2informaticos who allways gives good vibes and advices.

Good night:-)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Battery use -> no backlight...
threads.message:
Same behavior with battery alone (no charger connected)?

If charger and battery both connected, backlight still stays off, if you disconnect J6951?

Check <CHIP>U5255</CHIP> signals.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Battery use -> no backlight...
threads.message: Hi again. Finally Got the lb out (Damn lot of screws:-). <CHIP>U5255</CHIP> is well‚Ä¶ <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> is Stable and is 3.3 as it should. Had a tiny solderball from pin 6 (3gh). But nothing short‚Ä¶ Could it be roastet?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Battery use -> no backlight...
threads.message:
I was expectingto get <CHIP>U5255</CHIP> input and output voltages, when you don't get backlight.
Use boardview to find easiest points for test.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Battery use -> no backlight...
threads.message: Sorry‚Ä¶ misunderstood‚Ä¶ i vil find it for you:-)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Battery use -> no backlight...
threads.message: Hi again 2informaticos. I screwed up‚Ä¶ I thought after unplugging all the connections between housing and LB it works with and without the battery. What is wrong with the topcase? I do not know but something interfear with the backlight. Take a look at the picture battery and screen alone works fine but when it comes into the topcase funny things happens. I will find a new topcase amd voila ‚Ä¶ should work. Sorry for all the ‚Äúconcerns‚Äù:) and Thank you again. All fine nowüôå

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Battery use -> no backlight...
threads.message:
When you have the board placed on the chassis, disconnect the cables, one by on.
Check which connection blocks the backlight.
